nodes.bodyText:
it might be worth redirecting the output of this command to a file and including that file in the build artifacts. This will make it so that you can inspect them if Teku falls over during the build.
Something like build/install/teku/bin/teku --network=mainnet --Xinterop-enabled=true --rest-api-docs-enabled=true 2>&1 > teku_output.log &
and then add teku_output.log to your store_artifacts list.

nodes.bodyText: I already searched for this kind of plugin, but I did not find any that could fit our architecture (gradle + javalin annotations). The openapi generator one is not doing that, it's generating code and doc from spec, but it doesn't generate spec. The closest one would be https://github.com/openapi-tools/swagger-maven-plugin but it's not matching our tools for what I read.

nodes.bodyText:
If wget fails because of a response error (404, 500, etc), this will still write openapi.json, but it won't contain what you want (it'll be empty, or it will contain the body of the error response). Also be aware that store_artifacts always runs, regardless if previous steps were successful. We likely want to do something like the following instead of the single wget line that's here now:
EXIT_CODE=0
wget -O openapi.json http://localhost:5051/swagger-docs
if [ $? != 0 ]; then
  rm openapi.json
  EXIT_CODE=1
fi

kill $TEKU_PID
exit $EXIT_CODE
This will cause the build to fail if the output isn't what we're expecting. There are probably more idiomatic ways to write this, however.

nodes.bodyText:
I'm not familiar with this syntax - does ${CIRCLE_TAG-none} mean "use the contents of CIRCLE_TAG, or if it's empty, use none? If so, cool. If not, you'll likely want to create a new env var for this above like so
[ -n "$CIRCLE_TAG" ] && TAG_NAME="$CIRCLE_TAG" || TAG_NAME="none"
though this is probably better expressed as an if/else rather than a one-liner - it's more readable that way.

nodes.bodyText:
${parameter-default} and ${parameter:-default} are almost equivalent. The extra : makes a difference only when parameter has been declared, but is null.

https://www.tldp.org/LDP/abs/html/parameter-substitution.html

nodes.bodyText: If this file is generated, I don't think it should be committed. Instead, add the necessary steps to generate this file and include those as an earlier job in the build, similar to how you're generating the openapi.json file and persisting it via workspaces.
